intro: Oldenlandia garuensis, commonly known as the Guinean spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its showy, small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Oldenlandia garuensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
